trend_summary: Across the series, scattered villages lengthen along roads while farmland remains dominant. Fields consolidate, hedgerows thin, and forest patches enlarge in the west. Built-up growth is modest, keeping the area largely agrarian. The latest image shows widespread crop browning in the east, suggesting drought or harvest timing.
notable_changes: Village footprints enlarge slightly, especially along the central river corridor.
Agricultural fields merge into larger, more regular parcels; hedgerows decrease.
Forest cover expands in the north-western quadrant.
A new or widened roadway appears south-centre, improving connectivity.
Pronounced crop browning in eastern sector during the last epoch indicates drought stress or late-season harvest.
